newsitem.title: FRANCE: CIC says seeking majority shareholder.
newsitem.headline: CIC says seeking majority shareholder.

text.p: French regional banking group CIC, slated for privatisation this year, is seeking a high-quality majority shareholder and opposes any dismantlement, chairman Philippe Pontet said on Tuesday.
He told a news conference to present the group's results that he was also opposed to any buyout of the group by its regional banks, an idea floated in the French press.

Finance Minister Jean Arthuis scrapped his first attempt to sell CIC when he cancelled a privatisation tender last November after getting just one eligible offer -- from BNP -- for the group, which comprises 13 regional banks and has strong local links with small and medium sized businesses.
But he has pledged to sell the bank, a unit of state-owned insurer Groupe GAN, which itself is due for privatisation.
"There is no question of selling CIC in bits, by sectors," Pontet said. "We are seeking a majority, quality shareholder as our main shareholder, with GAN the second biggest shareholder."
